Question
========
Hamminga et al. want to perform a linear regression analysis. They assume that a sample has been drawn from a population in which X and Y are bivariate normally (simultaneously normal distribution for X and Y) distributed.

Which of the following properties need not hold?

Answerlist
----------
* The y-sections per x-value are normally distributed
* The y cross sections per x-value are homoscedastic
* Y depends linearly on X
* The y cross sections per x value all contain equal scores
